Reviews.Title: “location 9 hospitality 3”
Reviews.Author: gracekelley
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Pont Royal Hotel two weeks ago. For the first time ever, I lost my temper at a hotel. Rather than write a review while I was still angry, I waited until I could write a balanced review of the hotel.. First, the good points. I love this location. I like the left bank for its cafes, small shops and real neighborhoods. I especially like this location--a few blocks from the Pont Royal over the Seine to the Louvre. The hotel is also very close to the Musee d'Orsay. There isn't a better way to see Paris than on the Seine and it's only a five minute walk from the hotel. I also liked the rooms -bright, extremely clean with good bathrooms. I want to thank the hotel for upgrading our rooms to the fifth floor. I appreciated it and was set to love this hotel. The public areas need a redo, but they started renovating the bar when we were there. The breakfast room atmosphere was welcoming thanks to the lovely lady who ran it. However, the breakfast wasn't very good. The hotel says the expensive restaurant next to it prepares the breakfast. I worry about an expensive restarant that stretches the fruit salad with canned cling peaches. This hotel has location, history and nice rooms, but it lacks the most important thing a hotel can have-hospitality. On the third day of my stay when I lost my temper, it wasn't because of a single incident. This is a small hotel and you see the concierge ( especially cold) and the people at reception several times a day. Rather than smile or say a greeting, they glance at you and then look away. It's not a welcome atmosphere. To be fair, I had just come from London where a stayed in a hotel that had extraordinary service. If you think I may just be an impossible-to-please guest, please see my review of the Egerton House Hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular but good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: French-Doctor
Reviews.Content: Very pretty and comfortable hotel. Typically Parisian-style with an intellectual flavor you can appreciate in the general decoration and in the bar (very classical bookshelf like in every trendy places in Paris). What I really appreciated is that every detail was checked, either in the room or in the common parts. Nothing damaged or deteriorated. Nothing old-looking. I do not agree with the negative comments about the quality of the breakfast. I found more than two varieties of jam/marmelade! Certainly nothing original but everything of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff - felt very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Aucks67
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The front desk were polite and answered any questions we had. The door man was friendly and welcomed us warmly. Our room was very comfortable with lovely decor. We did not eat here as it was a little over priced at 25 euro, so given the location we had many options around us and enjoyed breakfast out. we used the metro a lot and took the roissy bus from the opera stop back to the airport which was only 10 euro each. We were very worried given stories of finding rude French people in Paris, we found the people warm, friendly and welcoming. I think it comes down to the simple message of, be kind to others and you in return will be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Some employees and concierge were rude to us”
Reviews.Author: Embktdnm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but the people were not. I believe because we were American they did not feel the need to make us feel welcome. They looked down when we talked to them, ignored us at sometimes, and treated us like they didn't want us there. The rooms were nice and some of the employees were delightful, but the others were rude and mean to us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 4* Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PeterGeo
Reviews.Content: Very good 4* hotel. Everyone very helpful, nice room, in the center of Paris. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “elegant interior, pleasant rooms, good location, bfast is a laugh”
Reviews.Author: Nostramadeus
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant, elegant interior and rooms, comfortable, with attention to detail. Central location. The breakfast doesn't go much beyond the standard French breakfast, which at this price is a laugh. Have a very good restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Davemc_12
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great location. Very friendly staff. Nice rooms. We look forward to staying there again on our next trip to Paris. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cdr473
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Pont Royal is a wonderful choice in Paris. If you want to stay in St. Germain but have easy access to the Right Bank, this is the perfect choice. The staff is helpful and the rooms are well-appointed. The Hotel Pont Royal is not the Meurice (which I love) but it is well-priced, cozy and in the heart of great shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sally S
Reviews.Content: The location is superb; we could walk easily to the Louvre, the Marais, and the Latin Quarter, as well as many bistros and cafes.The staff are professional and knowledgeable as well as very helpful and kind. Our room was quite nice as was the bathroom. American travellers should note that by American standards, the rooms are smallish, but ours was perfectly comfortable. We will certainly return to this hotel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: timarisu
Reviews.Content: Le Pont Royal is well located on the Left Bank. Warm welcome and discreet efficient service.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “The perfect 5 star boutique hotel and location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: C-Crummer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly reccommend by friends. It exceeded our expectations! It was my Mom and I for my 50th birthday. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Saint Germaine district is just around the corner from the Latin Quarter, shopping, museums everything. The staff was amazing and goes beyond and above. I love the bar, cozy and wonderful service. We will be back! Thank you everyone for making our trip to Paris so special.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Jacques1941
Reviews.Content: The Pont Royal is where we have stayed regularly for many years. This year we opted for a junior suite, because the regular rooms are, like most in Parisian hotels, on the small size. All the room amenities were offered -- minibar, DVD player, iPod connector, free and effective WiFi, Nespresso machine and more. There is a small gym downstairs. The room decor is subdued and elegant, and the bed and linens were most comfortable. The deep tub and shower had fine pressure, leading to indulgent baths every night. For those who want to forego the cost of minibar items, there is a supermarket across the street. The Left Bank could not be closer -- 3 blocks to the Seine and Quai Voltaire. One block to the Rue du Bac Metro station. Several good restaurants within 3 blocks. The hotel service was impeccable. Our concierge was extremely helpful, including having available "cut-the-line" tickets to the blockbuster Stein Family show at the Grand Palais, which obviated long lines and timed admissions. And, if you want ultra-chic dining, the Atelier de Joel Robuchon is in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location on the Left Bank and is close to the Orsay, the Louvre, Notre Dame, the subway. It is in a fabullous little shopping area too. The room was very large and pretty. The breakfast buffet was lovely and had fabulous food. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Sunnys_Day
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Paris so I don't really know what hotel room sizes are like but this was so small. I've never seen a room this small and this was an upgraded deluxe room. With two twin beds, a chair and a table there was literally no place to put suitcases or anything. We had the suitcases in the doorway to the hall and tripped over them constantly. Rarely did we have wi fi in the room and we were told they would put a booster in the room and they never did. There was no AC the first day and it was sweltering. On the up side the location was fabulous and the breakfast every morning was amazing! I don't think it was worth the money though.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, wifi problems, great concierge...mixed!”
Reviews.Author: travel4lifenow
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my elderly mother was made more difficult by the small rooms (even with an upgrade) at an old favorite of the family. It has definitely changed. Of the 4 nights, the wifi did not work for 2. And I certainly did not appreciate when the cleaning lady left the fridge door open all day and a bathroom garbage can in the sink...ugh. But, we loved the concierge, even if he could not fix the wifi (with which he said they frequently have problems). In the end, not worth the price for the size of the room, which had the WORST artwork over the bed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Xtinemd
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon and the hotel staff made efforts to decorate our room and gave us welcome champagne and delectable macaroons. The room we stayed in was spacious and we had our balcony with wonderful views of the city.Service was good and hospitable. Location was perfect as it was near many cafes , St germain de pres and just a stone's throw away from Musee D' Orsay and the river seine where you can easily cross to the louvre , head to the Ile St Louis and Notre Dame. Two metros are also nearby. If you are a foodie, the Michelin rated Joel de robuchon is just below the hotel :D

Reviews.Title: “C'est la vie!!”
Reviews.Author: Breck_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel oozes class from the minute you enter the reception area to the beautifully appointed rooms. Our views ranged from the Eiffel Tower to the Sacre Coeur and the hotel is well situated to explore the Rive Gauche and beyond the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaturePhotogUSA
Reviews.Content: The hotel Pont Royal should be avoided. I am an experienced global business traveler and Pont Royal gave me one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a hotel of that caliber. The value for the money is horrible. My first warning of poor service was upon arrival when no hotel staff came to assist with my suitcase or my wife’s. I then entered the lobby and encountered a very angry guest who was speaking (more like yelling) to one of the staff in a very animated way. She kept repeating, “how could you do this to me, you know I stay here all the time.” I then lined up to check-in and another angry guest was yelling at the receptionist about being given the wrong category of room. Check-in for me went smoothly but the room was small and faced the front of the hotel. That was OK until the heating and cooling system broke down and the room became unbearably hot. When I opened the window for fresh air, the street noise was overwhelming. The result was ZERO sleep for both my wife and I. Thank God we stayed only two nights. Upon checking out I was informed by the receptionist, who I interrupted while he was in an argument with another member of the hotel’s staff, that the heating and cooling system would not be fixed for several days due to no maintenance company being available to fix it! The morning before we checked out I asked the hotel staff to order a cab for a 7am pickup to take us to the airport for an early flight to Milan. I double checked my cab request the same afternoon and was told that it had been arranged. My wife and I decided to check out early to get out of the overheated room. While checking out I asked the receptionist if my 7am taxi had arrived. I was told that it had been ordered for 8am! Our flight to Milan would have been missed if my wife and I had not decided to checkout early to escape the unbearable room! While waiting for the cab to arrive I had to listen to the receptionist complain to me about what an awful place Hotel Pont Royal was to work and that most of the staff was demoralized and are looking for other jobs. I hope they are successful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great room and location”
Reviews.Author: newyork10011
Reviews.Content: This was quite a nice place to stay in Paris. Like most hotels, the rooms are small, but quite well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A trip of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Randy P
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 incredible nights at the Hotel Pont Royal to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday. We stayed in the Panoramic suite for the majority of our stay. The view from the balcony was breathtaking and worth the price for the room. The hotel staff was courteous and our concierge, Xavier and his staff, went out of their way to make this celebration a great one! They even arranged for us to have dinner at the Jules Verne restaurant in the EIffel Tower on our last night. Lovely flowers, champagne, and a large fruit basket welcomed us. I can't believe the trip is over and I am back in the states dreaming of Paris! The location was perfect just around the corner from great shopping and wonderful, famous, cafe's. Metro location Rue de bac was nearby as well. Pricey, but we splurged for this once in a lifetime trip.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: GentlemanHellraiser
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed for the one night and really made use of the hotels fantastic location, it is only a few minutes from the Le Saint Gremain, but just far enough to not hear any traffic. The hotel is located on a quiet street just off the main drag. Breakfast is rather basic, just the usual continental offerings. Rooms are to a nice standard, neither classical or modern in nature; just clean and tidy with nice views. The concierge was a useful tool we could make use of, Knowledgeable staff, friedly demeanour. I didn't have the oppurtunity to dine at the L'atelier de Joël Robuchon Restaurant, but I hear it is amazing, and usually attracts ques of people outside, which is attached to the hotel. In conclusion, this hotel does not have the glitz and the glamour that some of the other hotels offer in Paris, it isa truly lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: nycfussy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as lovely as I had remembered. Had stayed with my husband years before and remembered the amazing location and excellent help. Still true. Rooms small, but very clean, with comfortable beds and really good sheets. Location cannot be beat. Pricey, but we went in February, so not so bad. They always had good ideas for dinner and activities, concierge and front desk always available and helpful. One drawback- do not do room service, beyond pricey. Accommodating with respect to a change in rooms, we were a group of women and they put us near each other. Felt safe and secure. Good base to have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: jill f
Reviews.Content: Upper floor suite has the best view of the city to be had. Prices are great for the value given. Can't recommend it highly enough. It is the only hotel I will use in the future.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service hotel”
Reviews.Author: BAHAAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: Very pricey but then everything about traveling to Paris is pricey! Wonderful advice from the staff about restaurants and directions. They could not have been more helpful and kind, Rooms are typically small but plenty of room with lovey windows and views and large desk with drawers and counter space. WONDERFUL SHEETS AND COMFORTABLE BEDS! The location on the left bank is such an easy walk to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Rodin, great shopping and the best Patisserie is just a 2 min walk down from the hotel! (Kaiser -- it's so good I went back and bought out all they made of the Pistachio muffins for the flight home!!)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location, super service”
Reviews.Author: scott92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pont Royal as a repeat visitors. We had our travel agent, Kathi Sheridan get us upgraded to a Deluxe View room with a balcony/view and breakfast inculded. And we really did have a view from the 8th floor it was super. However, being on the highest floor of the hotel had its drawback; the room was deluxe but small. We were offered several other rooms which were larger but the private balcony, with two comfortable chairs/table won the day. All of the staff were very helpful with anything we asked. The concierge made reservations for us and helped with maps and planning some trips. Our location on the Rue de Bac was on the left bank near the Musee d' Orsey and the Rue St. Germane.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room with an amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Amy Bradley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and were lucky enough to be on a 7th floor room with a balcony. From there we look out over the city with a clear view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were immaculate, quiet and lovely. The breakfast was delicious and lasted us through lunch time. The location of the hotel can't be beat and the staff was extremely helpful with all of our questions and needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cannizz
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Pont Royal. It was nice, clean and in a great location - close to the Metro and walking distance to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was overbooked”
Reviews.Author: ibemeubu
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Pont Royal to find that the hotel didn't have a room for us on the first night. I asked if they overbooked, and they stated another guest had an issue and had to stay an extra night. We payed in advance, so they put us up at another hotel nearby. They also upgraded our room and gave us a museum voucher when we returned on the second day. They also were very apologetic. While the staff was very accomodating and contrite, I do wonder why the other guests weren't forced to move to another hotel room, and why a luxury hotel doesn't keep at least one room "in reserve" for these types of situations. Also, we showed up at about 2:00PM in the afternoon - surely there were guests checking in after us - I can only deduce thay because we booked and payed in advance through Agoda, we were at the bottom of the pecking order. Our junior suite was beautifully decorated and my wife loved it. I didn't like it as much because it was on the 2nd floor and I could noises from the 1st floor help staff throughout the night as they cleaned and prepared for breakfast (doors and cabinets opening and closing, scraping of tables being moved) - if you are a light sleeper like me, you may want to ask for something on the 3rd floor or higher. The location was excellent - short walk to the major museums, and in the heart of the St. Germaine district. There is also an excellent grocery store just across the street with a good produce and wine section.

Reviews.Title: “Service very poor-avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: iphonenyc
Reviews.Content: Pont Royal is located in a charming section of Paris near St Germain. I stayed four nights as a business traveler booked into a 600 euro a night room. All contact with the front desk or concierge was poor to a disaster. Dinner reservations from the concierge don't work out, they say they can have a taxi in ten minutes and in reality they can summon one all morning, my mini bar had old food and half open bottles from previous guest, The front desk is however excellent on excuses and attitude so one gets the feeling nothing will ever improve here. The rooms are pleasant but small, which is not uncommon for this part of town. I could never imagine another executive (or family) enjoying a stay at Pont Royal because of their consistent poor service combined with little desire to correct the situation. I have put the Pont Royal on my company's "Do Not Stay" list and I suggest that you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good value excellent location good service.”
Reviews.Author: sandra_gillespie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and found the hotel near to the metro and rail stations, about five minutes walk to the river and the Batobus which is a hop on hop off to all the historic attractions and cost only 14 euros. The hotel was very clean and the service was excellent. We had a classic room which was a good size and had everything we needed.. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel - Good Location, Desperately Needs Service!”
Reviews.Author: drandmrsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night for a return to Paris from a 2 week trip around Paris and Germany. We loved the Left Bank location and the room was very clean, although that's all I can say about the Pont Royal. The staff desperately needs a good course in customer service and Joel Robuchon needs to remove his name from their restaurant. The breakfast was horrible! Out of all the many hotels, Inns and B&B's in which we stayed throughout France and Germany, this was a sad ending to an otherwise perfect trip. I've heard the new Le Recaimer closeby is a wonderful boutique hotel and we'll try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT Poor Staff Attitude!”
Reviews.Author: DC-J-and-A
Reviews.Content: Although Hotel Pont Royal was a very convenient location for us and is quite a lovely hotel, we repeatedly had to ask for enough towels and soap for the two us (even though our reservation was for 2 people). Additionally, every other hotel we stayed in throughout our 12-day trip through France allowed us to borrow an adapter whereas the Hotel Pont Royal insisted on charging us $10Euro for an adapter the front desk rep seemed to have pulled from the lost and found drawer. When we questioned this, the desk manager became quite defensive and petulant. The "business center" is far from what one envisions a business center to be: it is one computer just outside of the breakfast room with seats that look like a wire frame covered in bright fabric. Upon arrival, we were told we could buy internet usage cards for either $5Euro or $10Euro and that the concierge would assist us with whatever we needed. That was NOT the case: we were only able to buy the most expensive internet cards and the concierge was not helpful at all when were were looking for information about dinner and tour cruises on the Seine. VERY DISSAPOINTING STAY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to celebrate a 10th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Kehsutton
Reviews.Content: Located right off of Saint-Germaine, this gem of a hotel is all about personalized service, quiet privacy, and outstanding dining opportunities. We were greeted with a bottle of champagne, and fruit upon checking in. Further, the concierge did an amazing job directing to several excellent restaurants that were off the beaten path. I hope to return for many more milestone anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “They charge you an extra fee without letting you know”
Reviews.Author: SibellaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for 3 days as part of our second honeymoon. We chose this hotel because of its location so close to the Musee Louvre, the d'Orsay, and the Seine. This hotel also had a flash rate online that we were able to take advantage of and pay for 3 nights in advance at a low price. When we arrived, the staff was very nice and helpful and let us know they had upgraded our room from Superior to Junior Suite. Our first clue to their shady business practices should have been that they wanted copies of our US Passports and my credit card. We obliged them without thinking much of their request. Then I logged in to my credit card account and found that they had charged my credit card 300 euros that day of check in. My husband and I were not told that this would happen and I did not sign anything allowing them to do this. My husband, who speaks French, talked with the hotel manager that evening who told us the hotel does this all the time as insurance for them, in case we take anything from the mini-bar without paying. We were infuriated. We asked them to take the charge off immediately, but they would not do so, saying that they would do so after we check out. We were unhappy and dissatisfied with this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: “We felt so comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: echohumpingmonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, everyone always had a smile on their face. The bed was so comfortable (possibly a Tempurpedic?). The location was great, walking distance to lots of shopping, restaurants, the Louvre, and metro stations. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesem25
Reviews.Content: My spouse & I recently spent a weekend in Paris at this hotel & it's a gem, The service was terrific, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the rooms were clean. The size was comfortable & though not as large compared to US rooms, there was plenty of space to store clothes, a nice desk with wi-fi services, a comfy chair and a cute little bathroom with enough vanity space for both my husband & I to store our toiletries. The location was great! It is on the left bank about a mile from the Eiffel tower with a Metro station about 1 block away. We could easily access any attraction or museum by metro or walking. Across the street was a Metroprix grocery store with a gourmet section of ready to go foods as well as a wine section. Perfect for late night snacks in our room . And when you want to get away from the "touristy" things to do, there are plenty of cafes & restaurants right within walking distance. We found some wonderful spots right under our nose. Wish I had taken more pix of the room but I was too busy drinking in the rest of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: Muppet50
Reviews.Content: Location was great, room very nice and staff excellent. Breakfast is a bit on the expensive side at 27euros. Bed was extremely comfortable and very low noise levels. Only negative was the shower, it varies in temperature throughout and isn't a particularly nice experience. Decor is very nice, check out was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Pont Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesky
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager Paul was so fantastic helped us in every way and the rooms wee just lovely and all within a short walk to the Louvre and the musee d'orsay absolutely fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kkdesign
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pont Royal a few days before and through New Years. We enjoyed our stay - the rooms were nicely decorateda and clean, we had beautiful view, and the location was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. What prevents me from giving it top rating is the lingering faint smoke smell that varied in strength during the course of a day....I don't know if it is the ventilation system or the fact that the building is old. We did not eat in the acclaimed restaurant as the prices were staggering. We found Eric Kayser Boulanger a block away and enjoyed breakfast there each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: Joestock
Reviews.Content: Always treated with kindness. Staff very helpful. They suggested location of room away from noise areas, large room, very efficient staff. Except for a church bell ringing every hour of the day which was not noticeable if you kept the windows shut. Close to museums. A big plus. Breakfast buffet outstanding as well as the World Class Restaurant adjoins the hotel. Robechon also catered the breakfast. Outstanding location to restaurants, bistros, taxi stands, metro, and subway. And great rates!

Reviews.Title: “A Paris delight”
Reviews.Author: ezz100
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel for a birthday treat and then I looked it up on this site and started to worry it might not be as wonderful as it looked but when we got there it was fantastic. The negative reviews are, I think, very unfair. Firstly the location is the best - set slightly behind the Musee D'Orsay and a few minutes walk to the Louvre. Its in a nice area with some lovely shops , bakeries and cafes. For a meal walk to the river and try the restaurant on the corner Frigare (or something like that !) . Tip top food at reasonable prices. The hotel itself is so clean and stylish. The staff were wonderful. The room was lovely with a small balcony. The bathroom was well equipped with a powerful shower. The bed and pillows were comfy and the linen was white and crisp. The only downside was the double bed was two singles zipped together ( why do hotels think this constitutes a double !!) . My partner had requested a double knowing this is my pet hate. However for once I did not complain because the room was so lovely I didn't want to move. When we checked out we mentioned it and they said we should have said it earlier as they would have been happy to sort it. The concierge was so helpful and he helped make our stay really wonderful. When we return to Paris we will always stay here - it is fabulous and I could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and Great location”
Reviews.Author: DKC2010 Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon and after 7 hotels in France this was our favorite we had a 5th floor room with a balcony that had views of the Eiffel tower! Very helpful staff ,we had champagne in our room every night that we got from the shop next door so it is easy to save a few euro. Just don't be a rude American and Paris is great, it is not the OC but don't expect it to be and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Extra charges on your credit card after your departure.”
Reviews.Author: DAVE1111_10
Reviews.Content: We did not use the mini bar, restaurant or anything else that would incur any extra charges. I used my credit card to pre-pay for our 4 night stay. 2 days, approximately, after we returned home they charged another € 19 to my card. I have emailed them twice from their website and still have had no response. I only want to know what the extra charge was for. Beware of unauthorized payments after your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Friendlt Staff”
Reviews.Author: SheilaJ3
Reviews.Content: I suprised my husband for his 50th birthday with a trip to Paris. As a travel agent, I agonized over hotel choices but am so glad I picked the Pont Royal. Julien at the front desk could was a gem. All the staff we encountered were friendly and our regular classic room was beautiful. I am glad I did not pay for the breakfast option as it was expensive because there are so many places within walking distance and we had a blast trying a new cafe everyday. The location of the Pont Royal was another plus -we were able to walk to almost all attractions and the RER as well as the underground stop are only a block away as are the bus stops. I would highly recommend and I have already referred friends who are going in April!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is relative”
Reviews.Author: Battistini1
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Pont Royal currently and am paying 366 dollars/night w/o breakfast. By comparison, I paid 495 dollars/night at the Raphael in August with breakfast. The Pont Royal's location for touristic purposes is much better. The Raphael had "faded elegance" while the Pont Royal is all new, deorated in the Art Deo style. The difference in room size is enormous. My Pont Royal room has a lovely view (my Raphael room had none) but one has to be extremely efficient with space. The Raphael's room was enormous. The staff at the Raphael was slightly better trained than at the Pont Royal. One example of an atmospheric difference: at the Raphael I could (and did) leave my shoes outside my room at night to be polished. At the Pont Royal this is a special service one has to arrange through the concierge. Both concierges did not hesitate to make and cancel reservations. Our Pont Royal room was not properly prepared our first night (it was very cold) but this corrected quickly. Internet is frustrating at both hotels. At the Raphael it is a paid service that had frequent interruptions. At the Pont Royal, an ethnet link is provided in the room (useless for my wife's laptop) and there is free wifi that must be accessed in the lobby. So when you read reviews critical of hotels based on their wifi mishaps, I think you have to realize the technology is just not there yet so that one could plan wifi in advance, like one can expect a working television for example. Regarding the room's size, i do not have the experience to compare the Pont Royal with other hotels on the Left Bank, but by reputation they all have small rooms. I would try another hotel were I to return, but not because the Pont Royal is not a good hotel, but because I want to try as much a possible. For me, the Raphael was perfection, except its location.

Reviews.Title: “great location BUT terribly bed”
Reviews.Author: twisha
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the best location- bang in the middlw of st germain and literally a 5 minute walk to the louvre. staff was excellent, concierge very nice and helpful- they all spoke english which is great because a lot of people in paris do not speak english. however, the rooms are a bit old and the beds are HORRIBLE. did not get proper sleep for the 4 nights we were there.... very soft bed and terribly soft pillows that gave no support. we asked for firmer pillows but they had none. i would not stay here again just for that because after a long day walking around in paris a good night sleep is essential and we just did not get that.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - RUDE, TINY, OLD - and did i mention rude?”
Reviews.Author: starz112
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pont Royal hotel during our recent visit to Paris and had the most unpleasant stay of our married life. First off, our flight got us in at 7:30 AM and after a night of no sleep on the plane, we were hoping to get checked-in early. But to our disappointment when we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the rudest man working the desk. He refused to even check if there was a room available and kept telling us we cannot check-in until 2:00pm - that was a good 6 hours away and we had arrived on a sunday (ie. everything in paris is closed!). We sat in the lobby for hours and kept checking back with the front desk. Finally a woman came and seemed nicer and said that there should be a room available and as she was checking of course the rude man came back and said something to her in french and assured us there were no rooms available - which seemed off because we had seen at least 10 couples check out while we were waiting. We quickly came to the conclusion that we need to catch the nicer woman when she is alone so the minute the rude man left, we went back up to her and she gave us a room. That was just the beginning of many similar stories at the pont royal. The room was TINY.. the double bed was 2 uneven twins stuck together, the heating did not work (and it was COLD in november), the bathroom smelled and everytime we asked the concierge to book us a dinner, he would get the date or time wrong. Not to mention, everytime we would call the front desk to check on the status of our requests (for blankets etc), they would screen us and we would have to go down in the middle of the night to find someone there just not picking up our calls. All in all it was an awful experience and we will be sure to never go back or recommend this place to anyone else - we would have checked out the day we arrived but unfortunately we paid everything upfront. Avoid the hassle and rudeness and stay elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Staff, great location and lovely facility”
Reviews.Author: khbrook
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mother to Paris/Normandy. I am in my 50s and my mother is in her 70s. There are plenty of affordable eateries in easy walking distance. The Louvre and Orsay are easily walkable. The room was clean, attractive, warm with an exceptionally nice bathroom and fluffy towels, makeup mirrors, bath products and other amenities. Every staff member (from the front desk to the maid) was very very helpful, cheerful and pleasant. They never refused a request for assistance whether for a cab, to call a shuttle, find a restaurant or museum or to break bills for euros. We did not have a view from our room but there are so many wonderful views out and about in Paris this was a minor if not insignificant point.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, with great location; but don't eat breakfast there!”
Reviews.Author: nyauthor
Reviews.Content: Elegant boutique hotel with pleasant enough staff; recent renovation means everything looks new and clean, a combination of 1920s/30s Paris chic but thoroughly modern conveniences. Terrific location, within easy walking distance of Tuileries, St-Germain, Musee D'Orsay -- and consequently nearby Metro, bus, and RER lines. We were given an upgrade, which -- though the room was still cosy -- had a small balcony from which you could see Sacre-Coeur. Very charming. But grab your breakfast from the nearby Kayser bakery; the hotel restaurant charges an outlandlish and outrageous 27 euro per person for their buffet breakfast; you have to fight with the indifferent staff (allegedly "overseen" -- HAH! -- by hot chef Joel Robuchon) for an a la carte omelet, which isn't even thoroughly cooked. They did nothing to remedy the problem, and could not have cared less. My husband couldn't even get a bit of baguette with his omelet because they wanted to then charge us 27 euros for getting it from the buffet (the only place where bread is available). Consequently, we left no tip. So, stay at the hotel, but save your money and your temper and eat anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect locale whilst staying in Paris”
Reviews.Author: steve9631
Reviews.Content: When traveling in ol' Paree, the Pont Royal Hotel is my pick, and has accomodated many left bank travelers and notables since 1923. Located smack in the heart of the left bank of Paris in Saint-Germain-des-Près, it's within walking distance of anything you came to Paris to see. The Pont Royal is a smaller type of boutique sort of hotel with all the ambiance and turn of the century Paris charm you probably traveled here for. There's a top chef style restaurant on the main floor, and the wood paneled old world LIterary Bar reeks of Hemingway, of which the hotel claims used to be one of his haunts. The rooms are European style, or small by American standards, but well maintained and spotlessly clean. Lotsa marble, and period furnishings. During our stay they were shooting a movie on the floor which we were staying, so they moved us to a suite so we wouldn't be bothered through the late evening. Talk about your ambiance in a hotel, and one steeped in history as well. The painters Miro, Chagall, and Buffet are all noted as former guests at the Pont Royal. The best thing about the hotel in my opinion though is the location. Two blocks from Boulevard Ste Germain des Pres, you can see the Lourve down the street from the lobby, about a 6 minute walk to the Musee d'Orsay, and the Seine is just before the Lourve. Topping that, there is a Metro stop about a block and a half west of the hotel entry, making it easy to get wherever you wish to go to in Paris a breeze. The area abounds with bakeries, great restaurants, the Cafe de Flore of legend ( a hang out for Jim Morrison, Hemmingway, Sartre, etc.), and the Latin Quarter and Arts district are an easy walk. Add to this a staff very familiar with guests from other countries, a very knowledgeable and street wise concierge, and this hotel gets my vote every time.

Reviews.Title: “Complete bliss”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelxoxo
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff was excellent. We really felt well taken care of. We stayed in the Penthouse Suite. I don't think there could be a better view of all of Paris and its monuments. The location is out of this world, everything you could need or want to see is within walking distance or a very short cab ride. The concierge is a master, he was able to secure a dinner reservation at the Jules Verne in the Eiffel tower, WINDOW SEAT! The entire stay was complete magic. Very hard to leave such a beautiful room with two terraces that oversee all of Paris in such glory.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: sandiegoguy
Reviews.Content: Great value. Convenient location in the 7th. Easy walk to the D'Orsay, the river, and the Metro. Rooms are very small, but adequate and clean. We were pleasantly surprised to find a Paris mid-range hotel with a shower curtain! (You Americans know what I mean.) English speaking staff very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast. Very comfortable bar to meet friends. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as Hotel Senat was full. Was a bit dearer and not quite as good overall but is a different style of hotel and was still good. Decor a bit dated but staff and service excellent. Room had a balcony with views for miles which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: MrsFussyLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the trendy St Germain area and has a boutique hotel feel about it as it is not oversized so you get good personal service. The concierge was very helpful. It is well located for everythng you need and is a short walk to place st germain and the restaurants etc in that area. You must try Le Relais de l'Entrecote on rue st benoit if you like steak - it is the most French place I have ever been. All they serve is steak frites. Add a bottle of good red wine and you can lose an afternoon in there! The restaurant attached to the hotel is a Joel Robuchon - I think it might have a michelin star (his other restaurant in Paris certainly does) so it is not a restaurant you can grab a snack every night but it is worth a go one night as the food is divine. One thing I particularly liked about this hotel was the bar area that had comfy chairs and was perfect for sitting with some hot chocolate after a hard day sightseeing. If you are in Paris for sightseeing I would recommend walking to the Rodin Museum which is a delight. The modern art museum at the Pompidou centre was also a bit of a surprise for us - they had some fantastic exhibitions.

Reviews.Title: “Small bedrooms - but good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Archieblackcat
Reviews.Content: Aware of the fact that Paris Hotel Rooms are on the small side, I booked a Deluxe Room at Hotel Pont Royal. When we saw the room we were surprised about the cramped space and asked the Hotel about it. There was no other alternative and we had to move some furniture to get around the bed and also climb over it in order not to bump into each other. Overall good practice for Submarine training. Room itself somewhat dated with picture of "sexy woman" over bed hanging at an angle. Otherwise good, quiet location across from the Louvre and staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Pont Royal”
Reviews.Author: oatness
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Pont Royal. We have 4 children and the hotel was fantastic. The location is perfect; 3 blocks from the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre. Half a block from the Rue St Germain. The included breakfast is perfect. Nobody in my family (ages 5-46) was disappointed. We will stay here on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SundayRiver2u
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris a lot and this hotel was definitely one of the better ones. The location was amazing, the staff was terrific, and the room was a good size, positively enormous for Paris actually! It felt much more like a 4-star hotel than a 3-star, although the price was quite high. A colleague got to stay in the very top, and I have to say her room, complete with a balcony with a gorgeous view of Sacre Couer and the Eiffel Tower, was just spectacular. Absolutely incredible.

Reviews.Title: “overprized”
Reviews.Author: licence
Reviews.Content: i'm just back from a 3 day trip in Paris, and stayed in the Hotel Pont Royal. i can be very brief about it! NOTHING special. totaly OVERPRIZED. i stayed in hotels in Paris that cost less the half of the 395€ i payed now for a small boring room. the breakfast 27euro is even poor. think this place is a total rip-off. spend you money elswhere in a nice hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: MalmoFitandfun
Reviews.Content: This was the first time at the Pont Royal and wanted a well located hotel for our perfect anniversary weekend. What a good choice! The Hotel is situated on the left bank and within walking distance of the Louvre and Hotel de Invaildes. The immediate area is a quiet, but being about 100metres from Rue St Germain you are close to an excellent collection of shops restaurants and cafes. There is a good bus service on Rue de Bac (69) which provides a frequent link to both Chatelet and the Eiffel Tower. The metro station Rue de Bac is 100 metres away. The hotel is lovely, nicely furnished and the rooms were very confortable. We were on the first floor fronting the hotel. There is free internet. The best part of our stay was the truly helpful english speaking staff who could not do enough to assist. The concierge recommended excellent restaurants within walking distance and nothing was too much trouble. We did not try the buffert breakfast, thought at 27Euros was to expensive. There is a huge choice of local cafes charging between 6 & 12 Euros. In part of ther hotel is the restaurant L'Atelier which is highly recommended but quite expensive. When you book this hotel book dinner at the restaurant at the same time. There is a long waiting list. Overall a very pleasant weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pont Royal”
Reviews.Author: tony10014
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated in the heart of the left bank, and walking distance from the museums. Simply and attractively furnished. Attentive and helpful staff. Some minor caveats. Space is at a premium in Paris, and the amount of space, in particular storage space, in our deluxe room was only barely sufficient. We wouldn't recommend the much smaller superior rooms. Breakfast was a bit disappointing - especially at the 27 Euro price. We would recommend breakfasting at any of the numerous cafes in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations Never Realized”
Reviews.Author: Springs059
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pont Royal during the last leg of a Honeymoon trip to Europe this past June 08'. We made our selection of this hotel premised upon reviews that we had read on Trip Advisor ourselves. Unfortunately, our stay fell far short of the great experieces that we had enjoyed at other properties and with a cruise line during this special trip. The Hotel Pont Royal was located in a fine location, however, that is the only positive that I can share of our stay. Upon booking our trip I let the management know on several occasions that this was a "Honeymoon" trip and that we would appreciate anything "special" that that might done for us during our stay. Throughout our trip at other hotels and on the cruise line we had been given perks from champagne, flowers, chocolate, fruit baskets, chocolate covered strawberries and even room upgrades where the facilities could provide them. All without asking! The Hotel Pont Royal did nothing and in fact never responded to simple promises and requests. The room was very poorly decorated with outdated linens from my guess, the 60's. We kindly asked for another room at the same price that was hopefully more elegantly decorated. The Management never even got back to us! We asked the concierge to make dinner reservations for us, but was never responded to with the information. One night we asked for a reservation at the well-known French Restaraunt attached to the hotel; as we had dined at another of this chef's restaraunt in Monte Carlo and enjoyed it. This time we waited for nearly 40 minutes after our reservation time to be seated. I believe our request was never made! The most frustrating for us was the fact that we had arranged with the management during our booking to provide us with a driver to pick us up and return us to the airport on the day of our departure. I checked upon our arrival and was told that all appeared to be in order. When it came time to leave however, the driver never showed and consequently we nearly missed our flight back to the states. Very poor service with little follow-up if I might say! There were several apologies extended, but that was it. I would never recomend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Bucci73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pont Royal for 3 nights in late May. All I can say is that this is a very average hotel and definitely not worth the price they're charging. As previous reviewers have stated, the location is fantastic and easy walking distance to just about everything you'd want to see. We chose it because if it's location near Saint Germain des Pres and the fabulous shops and restaurants. We spent a lot of time walking around the Latin Quarter, Ile Saint Louis, Notre Dame and Centre Pompidou and this hotel was a perfect starting point to get to all of those locations. As for the hotel itself, the rooms need a MAJOR renovation. The lobby is lovely but once you get to your room it's a total disconnect. We were told when we arrived that we had been upgraded to a Superior room--which is great--except when we saw it we immediately asked what made this room different from the room we had booked and they said, 'nothing, they're basically the exact same'. So much for the upgrade. The room was extremely tiny and the decor is outdated and crappy. We were only in our room for about 5 minutes before it became obvious to us that it could not sustain electricity as well. We were then moved to another room (same shape and size) on a higher floor. The only redeeming value of this room was that it had a balcony--which we loved and sat outside having cocktails at sundown. You should be aware that the rooms do not in any way resemble what you will see on their pamphlets and advertisements. These rooms are completely different and don't even seem like they're from the same hotel. Nothing is similar except the look of the lobby. On positive note, the staff was lovely and accommodating. In sum, I would not spend the money to stay here again. I've been to Paris many times and this was by far the worst hotel in terms of the look of their hotel rooms versus price. If that does not bother you then it's a great location in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very average, stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: tr1pLondon
Reviews.Content: Sure it's in a central location and once had famous guests (in the 1940's), but this is a really average hotel- and for the money just not worth it. Main gripes were uninspired room decor, which was poorly finished- think any anonymous budget hotel chain (travelodge)- certainly not the luxury fittings we expected for the fee. We always stay in 4-5 * hotels across the world- this was a 2&1/2 * at best. Rooms were too small for the price tag. Staff were pretty uninterested- we had to wait for a few minutes for the inoperable doors to be opened to get back into the hotel most of the time, day and night. Bar and breakfast over-priced. I don't mind paying a lot for staying at great hotels, but I do object to paying a lot for an average hotel. Unsurprisingly, we won't be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: kikihanklove2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pont Royal for our honeymoon. We found their name through a company we were going to be joining the week after our stay in Paris. We went to the hotel website and found there were many packages to choose from that were far more reasonable than just reserving a room for the week. Our package included a driver picking us up from the airport (which was so wonderful after a 13 hour flight), a junior suite, complimentary breakfast buffet in the tea room and VIP service. We felt like VIP guests. The staff treated us very very well. There were no communication barriers and anytime we needed something they were there to help. Our room had a view of the street with views of the Eiffel Tower and other wonderful sites of Paris. It was wonderful. The hotel is located on the left bank which I guess is not considered as ritzy as the right bank; however it didn't seem that way. I enjoyed being on that side of the Seine. We were within walking distance of everything or if not then the metro station was a couple of steps away or the train stations. We walked down to the Latin Quarter almost every night for dinner, where we found the nightlife to be lively and the prices not so expensive since we were in a college district. We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel because we had read prior it is super expensive and we saw the prices which confirmed it. There are plenty of nearby local restaurants to eat at for the fraction of the cost. Also, there is a wonderful bakery down the street where the croissonts are to die for. They serve full breakfasts too. We had a wonderful time and when we go back to Paris we will be seeking out this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for central Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia54
Reviews.Content: Paris IS expensive at the moment, mainly because of the poor exchange rate against sterling and the dollar, so just be prepared to pay more than you expect. The Pont Royal is not a bargain, but I thought it was good value considering the location, size of rooms, the quality of the accommodation, and the excellent service we got. We had 2 deluxe rooms, well furnished, which were large by Paris standards and had room for easy chairs and a writing desk. The staff were very polite and helpful, offered to speak French or English as we preferred, and offered us maps and hotel umbrellas on a rainy day. They also recovered and returned property we had left behind! We had hotel breakfasts in the deal, and the buffet had everything you would expect in a British hotel, plus proper croissants! The Pont Royal is 5 mins walk from the Seine, and less than 10 mins from both the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay, so we walked everywhere instead of taking the metro. The neighbourhood is very good, with interesting shops, and Bon Marche is 10 mins walk away. Our best local meal was at L'Epi Dupin (wonderful food for 34 euros) but you must book, and the salted caramel icecream at Berthillaud's in the Ile St Louis is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LVITraveler
Reviews.Content: We bought an Expedia package for Christmas in Paris. I chose Hotel Pont Royal for the location. It was a great choice! We could easily get anywhere we wanted on the metro (stop located one block away). The room was well kept and appointed. The staff was wonderful. This was the best we have ever been treated while in Paris. The restaurant associated with the hotel was expensive but good. We enjoyed the unusual bar setting which lends itself for visiting with others and sharing stories--which we did. If you stay on the 6th floor or higher, you can look out your window and see the Eiffel Tower, Sacre Cour, and the top of the Orsay in panorama (see photos). There was no street noise but the walls are a little thin. Air and heat was quiet. Perfumed halls. We will definitely stay there on our next trip. We found the best food and least expensive can be found at restaurants around the Arc de Triomphe and its connecting streets. The worse part of the trip was having to give the cab driver 60 Euros for a ride to Charles De Gaulle.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: RuthAnn1
Reviews.Content: Not my choice to stay here. Good location, but very expensive. This was my first time in Paris and we spent most of our time out of the room which was double the price of every other hotel I was considering. Not good value for a place to sleep. Paid 9 Euros for a bottle of beer in the bar! We ate one dinner in the Atelier du Joel Robichaud next door which was also wickedly expensive and not worth it. Staff helpful and had a nice fitness room that looked like it was never used. If I won the lottery, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mangetout Mangetout”
Reviews.Author: Superally2007
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel - stayed for our anniversary- the room was nice if very compact- deluxe room- would hate to see what the other rooms were like. Never ate couldnt get a reservation at the over priced and up its self restaurant ( you even have to sit on bar stools). Get the concierge to book you a meal somewhere - he booked us into a fine place. Overall good hotel, quiet rooms, good beds, clean, free internet good location and nice staff. Only downside- bar prices a bit steep my bar bill was £298 ouch but i did have a few brandys and stupidly drank the champers in the room. But hey ho! or should i say HIC!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PabsKuch
Reviews.Content: This our home away from home every time we are in Paris. We have stayed at Pont Royal many times before and always is such a great hotel, the location, the staff, the view from our suite, everything just great. A great hotel without all the superficial environments of other hotels. Definitely coming back next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pont Royal, Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: MyEnzo1
Reviews.Content: A home away from home. This hotel is always my first choice. The rooms are large than other hotels at higher prices. I have probably been to this hotel 10 times. Also, Ritz, Intercontinental and recently Hotel Montalembert. No one can meet the high standards of Pont Royal. Hooray! They got hair dryers a woman can appreciate! Robes, slippers and other amenities really make it warm. The check in process is really prompt. Even when you arrive early which most do, they try to get you into your rooms quickly. Hotel staff are outstanding for the most part. You may have one that is not willing to go above and beyond. Other than that. Rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pont Royal!”
Reviews.Author: PollyAberdeen
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pont Royal and enjoyed every minute! The Pont Royal is perfectly situated in the lovely area of St Germain and is in walking distance of many of the wonderful sights that Paris has to offer. The hotel is nicely decorated and has a relaxing atmosphere which is largely created by the friendly and accommodating staff. The hotel bar is perfect for those seeking a quiet drink and offers a range of decent cocktails. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would definately recommend to anyone. Tip - Take a trip to the Jardin de Luxembourg on a sunny Sunday morning - a great way to relax and take in the French way of life.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Freya77
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are absolutely lovely, very accommodating. I really liked the atmosphere and the decor of the lobby, and the size of the rooms was pretty reasonable by Paris standards. I would however agree with someone else's comment about the air-conditioning, we couldn't get it to work. Still, all in all it's a great location , very quiet, and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: cdennison
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Pont Royal. The rooms were well decorated, and very clean. The service was perfect with every request granted quickly and with a smile. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a well-kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: atlantic-traveler
Reviews.Content: The Pont Royal hotel offers hotel rooms of a quality superior to that usually found in Paris. Rooms are slightly smaller that those found in some other hotels but the cleanliness and quality of this establishment more than make up for this shortfall. Rue du Bac Metro station is just two or three minutes' walk from the property, and the centre of St Germain with its famous cafes is about ten or fifteen minutes on foot. The Louvre Museum and the rue de Rivoli are also a short walk away and the route takes in a scenic walk over the Pont Royal across the river. The restaurant Atelier du Joel Robuchon attached to the hotel serves excellent quality food. The restaurant serves diners seated on stools at counters, which will appeal to those looking for a contemporary environment. A highly recommended hotel, and one that I shall visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pont Royal, Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MyEnzo1
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at Hotel Pont Royal and we did not regret a moment of our stay. The hotel staff are helpful, courteous and willing to go the extra mile. The value, the location and small size of the hotel are perfect for a more personal touch. We have stayed at The Ritz and InterContinnetal amongst other finer hotels of the world; while the Ritz is over the top, it has nothing on Hotel Pont Royal when it comes to service. As a woman, the only amenity they lack is a real hair dryer. The one on the wall just doesn't cut it! I highly recommend Hotel Pont Royal as it makes you feel at home. New York is where I live, Paris is my home. Janine New York

Reviews.Title: “A Deluxe Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: wiseandsavvy
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent said this was a great value at 330 EU per night and we were promised a deluxe room with breakfast included , and we were advised to book quickly. The room was so incredibly small with a closet fit for a child. My husband and I found fitting into these accomodations was like working a puzzle. The room was poorly air conditioned. The bathroom was adequate. Despite the Do Not Disturb sign on the door, the maid either rang the phone or knocked on the door, thus disturbing a late afternoon nap. Breakfast was so poor that we chose not to eat the following four mornings in the hotel and instead ate in cafes on Saint Germain - a five minute walk from the hotel. The head concierge was indifferent and clearly was working to accomodate his business clientele instead of those on holiday, and even when assisting business people, we observed a poor attitude, often going through his bookings centerstage with no regard for those around him. We travel often and this was an unimpressive experience in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingCCgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Pont Royal on our honeymoon. The rooms were small, but since we're from NYC we are used to that! The hotel was clean and the staff was so friendly. I loved how cleaning staff would pop their heads out of rooms to say "bonjour" as we walked by. There was such a warm feeling in the hotel. The location was also amazing. I would highly reccomend the hotel, and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: t_hajwane
Reviews.Content: I almost spent the best part of my first year of marriage looking for a hotel for our 1st anniversary trip, having heard stories of small, gaudy rooms with below par customer service, i was almost over cautious about where we stayed, wanting a perfect trip, traditional yet contemporary, within distance to great romantic strolls and fine cafe's, one may almost say i was being too picky.. i thought so to, then came along pont royal, the minute we got there we were in awe, a short walk from rue de bac (absolutely crucial, since its by far the cheapest, quickest and easiest way to get around), the lobby was carpeted with marble with a very luxurious feel to it, the concierge and reception desk were great, got into our room, yes was small BUT was perfect, extremely comfortable bed, great bathroom/shower amenties and a small balcony where we had an ample view.. We had breakfast once at the hotel the25euro breakfast buffet was a bit of joke although we did try the a la carte once which was reasonalbe, breakfast was regularly indulged in at a cafe close to the river, sensational! The hotel has everything, swift and friendly service, a 5 minute walk to the river, a less then 10 minute walk to the Louvre, less then ten to the batobus (good weather?definitely a good way to get around). Paris can be a gamble, the pont royal ensures you're on to a sure thing! Thumbs up all the way! Enjoy the pics!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: quickmaxx
Reviews.Content: My children and I just enjoyed three wonderful nights at the Hotel Pont Royal. I had stayed here two years ago and liked it enough then to stay here a second time. It was even better this time. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a triple room with a patio. Plenty of room with a decent size bathroom. The staff are so friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet, yet it is in the best location. We could pretty much walk anywhere and when it was too far to walk - well there is a Metro station right around the corner from the hotel. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, but there is a great little bakery right across the street where we got our breakfast each morning. I really recommend this hotel, it is a great find and you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveller97
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Pont Royal. Took a little bit longer than we expected for our room to be ready but the hotel was at full capacity, so certainly not out of the ordinary. So we took a short stroll to the Jardin des Tuileries by the Louvre for lunch. Our room was very clean and comfortable and larger than we expected for a european hotel. The concierges were extremely helpful and friendly. We did not eat at the restaurant but did enjoy a cocktail in the Library bar and the service was good. We particularly loved the location. Short walking distance to the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay, St. Germain des pres district (great shopping) and several metro stations. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Clean, modern comfortable and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel for four nights (Oct. 12-17) and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very freindly and helpful. Our room was rather small and dark. It took a little getting used to since we had just come from Amsterdam and Brussels where we had much more spacious and bright rooms for less money. However, the Pont Royal rooms were luxourious compared to hotels of similiar costs in Paris. The location can't be beat. It so close to so many sites and resteraunts. Great value in Paris!! It was worth trading off room space for such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “terribly over-rated”
Reviews.Author: adrlarry_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pont Royal the second week in October at the recommendation of a friend's agent (who got a fee for the service).Although we were to be given a deluxe, ie. larger room ,what we got was standard for Paris-barely sufficient. The amenities were standard. The staff was indifferent, bordering on the surly,the first time in many trips to France and Paris that we have encountered such an attitude. The hotel's location was acceptable ,if one did not mind a moderately long walk to the Louvre and an inconvenient stroll to the Metro. There was nothing of interest in the immediate vicinity. This is not one of the better locations or for that matter, one of the better small hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: UnaDaly
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the recommendation of a travel agent. Upgraded to a deluxe room based on reviews from the tripadvisor site. Glad I did so. The room was a reasonable size with a good sized bathroom and lovely view. However, the room was not huge, have stayed in other deluxe rooms and this was just about average. The concierge (George), though, was wonderful. He was quite frankly the best thing about this hotel. When I spoke French to most of the other hotel staff they replied in English. George was the only one not to reply in English but French. My French is quite rusty but I was looking forward to practicing in France. The location of the hotel is wonderful as it is very close to the Musee d'Orsay and the Seine. Be warned, however, do not eat at the hotel's restaurant. This consists of barstools at a bar and the heat is unbearable. The fixed menu costs 98EURO per person for sitting on a bar stool. Overpriced and overrated. There is a fantastic restaurant on the rue de Verneuil (out of the hotel door and 2nd street on the left) called Le Rouge Vif. This is fabulous and reasonably priced. A joy to eat in. If I was going back to Paris again, I would not stay at this hotel again. Although the room was lovely the hotel itself was just adequate. The high cost paid is too much for the merely adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pont Royal from Oct 3rd-10th, 2005 for our honeymoon and we were extremely happy with our time there. After reading a number of great reviews on this site, I had high expectations and they were met. First of all, the location absolutely cannot be beaten. You are 3 blocks behind the Musee d'Orsay and directly across the river from the Louvre, rue de Rivoli and close to the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. There is a Metro station 1 block from the hotel allowing quick access to all of Paris. Our room was beautiful, not super big, but very comfortable with lots of dark wood (just like their website). The bathroom was very nice, lots of marble, bright and super clean. Our room was turned down 3-4 times a day and the maid service was impeccable. The front desk and concierge staff were very nice. Bruno and Pierre were great, and even managed to get us last minute tickets to the opera. The daily breakfast was quite good with lots of freshly squeezed juice and our favourite, Parisian croissants. All in all, a fantastic location and excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pont Royal”
Reviews.Author: swaffy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, the rooms are clean and the bathrooms have been updated and are very modern. The room was a little small, but no smaller than a room in NYC. The staff was friendly and the location was great. The concierge was very helpful, as was the staff at the front desk. I was surprised at how quiet the room was considering we were on the second floor facing the Rue du Bac. We never heard a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely stay...”
Reviews.Author: SebaMed
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Pont Royal for 1 week. When we arrived around 12noon, our room was about ready for us. We had a lovely but small adequate room on the fifth floor facing the front with a little private balcony-shown directly to us by the front desk upon arrival. The halls had a very nice fresh citrus smell. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel (quite expensive) -because there were plenty of nice cafes around the area (especially Le Terminus (right on Rue du Bac across the Musee d'Orsay Museum- walking distance of 3 blocks away). Our only meal at the hotel was on the last day of our stay when we ordered room service (pricey but the steak tasted great). The hotel site was awesome in terms of location -literally 5-10 minutes to the Musee d'Orsay, 10min to the Seine River, 10-15min to the Louve, 20min to Notre Dame/Ile de Cite, 15min to to St.Germain area, and easy access to the metro/RER subway system to the Eiffel Tower as well to other sites. Everywhere we went was pretty much walkable from the hotel. We booked our trip via Expedia- including our day excursions with Paris Vision - and lucky us that the Paris Vision office (site of where the tours begin) was 15min away from our hotel. The staff was lovely and helpful. Lovely bathrobes and slippers in the room (although they forgot to put in the room when we arrived). We would definitely stay at the Hotel Pont Royal again. Made our stay in Paris very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK........but......”
Reviews.Author: Pimbletts
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pont Royal for our 10th Wedding Anniversary - first time with both of us away from children - so quite special for us. We had a deluxe room so were expecting something quite special. It was ok, believe me - but just OK. We were on the 5th floor and DID have air con (note previous comment). We had balcony to the front which was nice but the road is quite noisy and with building work opposite made for a early wake-up call. The room was very clean, and the shower good. The breakfast was so madly expensive it was a joke, as was the mini bar. We did have a complementary bottle of wine which was welcomed before our Moulin Rouge trip. The hotel was fine, believe me and perhaps we are not experienced enough as to what to expect. Concierge service as FAB - lovely guy who was so helpful at all times. Reception were very efficient as well. Location wasn't too good for us - too far away from any night life or shops to browse around and the metro station was nearby but not easily linked to other lines.....it was great if you like looking at antique shops...mmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Splendid.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and recieved a great welcome, even though it was after 11pm. Hotel room was a good size, with everything you would need. Location was perfect, 5 minutes and your in the centre of touriesty Paris, 5 minutes other direction and in the heart of Parisian cafe' culture. The breakfast's are expensive, and not included in the price of the room, so don't really bother with them, unless it was an extremely late night!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pont Royal
HotelInfo.Address: 5-7 rue de Montalembert | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
